titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 265
CWG14251

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 6

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, May 30th, 1865.

28. Under the provisions of General Orders, No. 82, May 6th, 1865, from this Office, the following officers are hereby mustered out and honorably discharged the service of the United States, to take effect May 15th, 1865, on account of their services being no longer required, and physical disability. They will receive no final payments, until they have satisfied the Pay Department that they are not indebted to the Government: --

Captain Presely F. Hansbrough, 11th Kentucky Cavalry.
The vacancies created by these discharges will not be filled.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
Hansbrough P. F
Capt.
Order
mustering out and honorably discharging him from service
Recd A. G. O. June 10. 1865
